intro: Micropterum papulosum, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its fuzzy, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. Micropterum papulosum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in arid and semi-arid regions.
